text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service

Incorporated Internal Guidance Memorandum TEGE-07-0218-0008, Form 1024-A, Application for Recognition of Exemption Under Section 501(c)(4) of the Internal Revenue Code.

Tax Exempt and Government Entities Exempt Organizations Rulings and Agreements
Table of Contents
Audience: The procedures in this IRM apply to employees in the EO Rulings and Agreements (R&A), Processing and Support, Adjustments Unit.
This manual uses the following acronyms:

Acronym Deﬁnition AIS Application Identiﬁcation Sheet CSPC Cincinnati Submission Processing Center DLN Document Locator Number EDS EP/EO Determination System EIN Employer Identiﬁcation Number EO Exempt Organizations EP Employee Plans IDRS Integrated Data Retrieval System LINUS Letter, Information, and Network User-Fee System POA Power of Attorney
7.21 Exempt Organizations Determinations Processing
Acronym Deﬁnition TEDS Tax Exempt Determination System TRAC TE/GE Rulings and Agreements Control (
) The Cincinnati Submission Processing Center (CSPC) is responsible for cessing user fees submitted with Exempt Organizations (EO) and Plans (EP) determination letter requests. See IRM
, Processing Employee Plan and Exempt Organization Determination Applications and Fees. (
) Locations other than CSPC occasionally receive user fees checks. The receiving location completes certain actions before sending the payment to CSPC for deposit. (
) EO R&A, Processing and Support Section maintains a locked area with trolled access for user fee payments it receives. (

) To process a user fee check: • Make sure the check is complete and payable to United States (or a variation). • Stamp United States Treasury on the check if the payee line on the check or money order is blank or incomplete. • Contact your manager if you believe the check or money order be returned to the submitter. Example: The check or money order is not ﬁlled out completely; the organization submitted Form
but is automatically revoked; or the organization and POA both submitted
Acronym Deﬁnition TEDS Tax Exempt Determination System TRAC TE/GE Rulings and Agreements Control

(or a variation). Stamp United States Treasury on the check if the payee line on the check or money order is blank or incomplete. Contact your manager if you believe the check or money order should be returned to the submitter.
For an EO hard copy case, prepare a user fee page/form based on the type of request, write the payment amount in red ink, and initial the form using:
Request Form User Fee Page/Form Form 1023 Page 11 Form 1024 Form 8718 Form 1024-A Form 8718 Form 8940 Form 8940 Letter Request Form 8718
Complete Form 14267, User Fee Check Transmittal Form,
Note: An application returned as incomplete is entered into LINUS but isn’t scanned into TEDS.
Contacts EO R&A, Processing and Support when a user fee check is dishonored.

Sends a copy of the dishonored check to the Adjustments Unit with a transmittal indicating the name and/or Document Locator Number of the case. To process the dishonored payment: a. Cross reference the DLN/name on LINUS to get the correct EIN. b. Write the EIN on the bottom of the check. c. In LINUS Refund, click on the correct DLN. d. Select Dishonored Check from the drop

down options. e. Select Request User Fee Payment with Letter. f. Enter DISHONOR DATE and CHECK NUMBER at prompts. g. Select SPLIT, SAVE, then CLOSE. h. For a hard copy (EDS) case, zero out the user fee ﬁeld and update the Dishonored Check ﬁeld to “Y.” LINUS automatically updates the ored check ﬁeld for TEDS cases. Caution: If TEDS owns the case, don’t update the case in EDS (which puts an EDS Block on the case and the case can’t be worked
Contacts EO R&A, Processing and Support when a user fee check is dishonored.
Sends a copy of the dishonored check to the Adjustments Unit with a transmittal indicating the name and/or Document Locator Number (DLN) of the case.
Cross reference the DLN/name on LINUS to get the correct EIN. Write the EIN on the bottom of the check. In LINUS Refund, click on the correct DLN. Select Dishonored Check from the drop

down options. Select Request User Fee Payment with Letter. Enter DISHONOR DATE and CHECK NUMBER at prompts. Select SPLIT, SAVE, then CLOSE. For a hard copy (EDS) case, zero out the user fee ﬁeld and update Dishonored Check ﬁeld to “Y.” LINUS automatically updates the ored check ﬁeld for TEDS cases.
Exempt Organizations Determinations Processing

) If a Determinations specialist (or an organization itself) discovers that a user fee payment isn’t correctly recorded in LINUS, he/she notiﬁes the and Unit. Fees (
) If a submitted user fee payment isn’t recorded on LINUS but posted in IDRS, the payment must be sent as a money transfer from IDRS to LINUS. (
) A Determinations specialist makes sure EDS reﬂects the correct user fee payment with the correct form submission. This may involve moving a user from one form to another.
If a Determinations specialist (or an organization itself) discovers that a user fee payment isn’t correctly recorded in LINUS, he/she notiﬁes the Adjustments
If a submitted user fee payment isn’t recorded on LINUS but posted in IDRS, the payment must be sent as a money transfer from IDRS to LINUS.

Example: An organization submits Form 1023 and then submits Form 1024, changing its requested subsection, because it didn’t meet the require- ments of IRC 501(c)(3). The specialist must ask Adjustments to move the user fee from Form 1023 to Form 1024 in EDS.

) The Adjustments Unit inputs user fee refund requests from both EO and EP. (
) Beckley Finance Center processes user fee refunds. The Kansas City generates and mails the checks. (
) EO Determinations specialists and tax examiners initiate: • A partial user fee refund when an organization overpays a user fee amount • A full refund because of current exemption, Form
-EZ non- acceptance, etc.
A partial user fee refund when an organization overpays a user amount A full refund because of current exemption, Form
-EZ non- acceptance, etc.
Exempt Organizations Determinations (
) The Adjustments Unit receives refund requests by hard copy, email, or If an EO employee prepares and submits a refund request at case closing, Adjustments Unit receives the entire case ﬁle. (
) To initiate a refund, an EO employee completes Form
, User Fee Request, and attaches an EDS case print. (
) The Adjustments Unit inputs the user fee refund request based on the EO employee submitted. Note: If Form
is not signed by a group manager, return the form to the nating group manager. (
) The Adjustments Unit maintains: • A refund spreadsheet and memo for each refund case • A copy of Form
with the attachments (

) To input an EO user fee refund request in LINUS: a. Open LINUS Refund and click on EO LOOKUP. Fee Refund b. Input the EIN to show the user fee. c. Click on the arrow next to the DLN that the refund is issued under. d. In the ACTION box, click on REFUND. e. In the REFUND box, highlight the reason for the refund. f. Input the current date. g. In the FEE RECEIVED box, input the refund amount. h. Hit the split button (LINUS automatically splits the amount). i. Click SAVE (refund shows on the refund screen). j. Print a copy of the refund screen. (
) Update the EDS user fee ﬁeld to reﬂect the user fee after the refund. Print copy of the EDS screen showing the updated user fee. Example: EDS shows an $
user fee, and the refund is $
; update the fee ﬁeld to $
) After entering

refunds in LINUS, input information on a user fee refund spreadsheet using the LINUS prints. Enter the following for each refund: • Organization name • Address • EIN • Received date (date of original deposit) • Amount paid • Amount refunded (

) Email the completed spreadsheet with a memo to Beckley Finance Center, including the total amount of all refunds to be issued. Email to *CFO BFC Collection Helpdesk. Copy the Adjustments Unit manager on the email. (

Organizations Determinations Processing
7.21.2.5.1.1 (07-18-2018) EO User Fee Refund Processing

Open LINUS Refund and click on EO LOOKUP. Input the EIN to show the user fee. Click on the arrow next to the DLN that the refund is issued In the ACTION box, click on REFUND. In the REFUND box, highlight the reason for the refund. Input the current date. In the FEE RECEIVED box, input the refund amount. Hit the split button (LINUS automatically splits the amount). Click SAVE (refund shows on the refund screen). a copy of the refund screen.
Update the EDS user fee ﬁeld to reﬂect the user fee after the refund. Print a copy of the EDS screen showing the updated user fee.
Example: EDS shows an $850 user fee, and the refund is $450; update the user fee ﬁeld to $400.
After entering 50 refunds in LINUS, input information on a user fee refund spreadsheet using the LINUS prints. Enter the following for each refund:
A partial user fee refund when an organization overpays a user amount.

Item Details Form 1725, Routing Slip • Plan name • Plan number • Specialist name • Specialist phone number • EIN • Refund reason • Refund amount • Group manager’s signature and date EP User Fee Refund Request • Plan name • EIN • Refund reason • Refund amount with split • Specialist’s signature, phone number, and date • Group manager’s signature and date Form 8717 • Plan name • EIN • Plan number • Amount paid • Application submitted fee schedule Form 5300, 5307, or 5310 • Page 1 of the application showing the DLN and the postmark/received applica- tion date

To input an EP user fee refund request in LINUS: a. Open LINUS Refund and click on EP LOOKUP. b. Input the EIN to show the user fee. c. Click on the arrow next to the DLN that the refund is issued under. Caution: Look for the plan number or appropriate postmark/received dates if there is more than one plan with the same plan d. Click VIEW TRANSACTIONS to show the user fees paid. e. In the ACTION box, click on REFUND. f. In the REFUND box, highlight the reason for the refund. g. Input the current date. h. In the FEE RECEIVED box, input the refund amount. i. Hit the split button (LINUS automatically splits the amount). j. Click SAVE (refund shows on the refund screen). k. Print a copy of the refund screen.
7.21.2.5.2.1 (07-18-2018) EP User Fee Refund Processing
Caution: Look for the plan number or appropriate postmark/received dates if there is more than one plan with the same plan name.

Click VIEW TRANSACTIONS to show the user fees paid. In the ACTION box, click on REFUND. In the REFUND box, highlight the reason for the refund. Input the current date. In the FEE RECEIVED box, input the refund amount. Hit the split button (LINUS automatically splits the amount). Click SAVE (refund shows on the refund screen). Print a copy of the refund screen.

(3) After entering 50 refunds in LINUS, input information on a user fee refund spreadsheet using the LINUS prints. For each refund, enter:

a. Log on to TRAC. b. Then MAPICS/ HQEP. c. Click on FORMS. d. Click on CINCINNATI USER FEE PROCESSING/HQ-VC User Fee Pro- cessing. e. Click on QUERY. f. Tab to the CTRL NO. g. Enter the ctrl # from the MAPICS user fee information sheet. h. Click RUN. i. Click or tab to the EIN ﬁeld and enter the EIN from the user fee refund request form. j. Click or tab to the REFUND AMT ﬁeld and enter the refund amount from the ROUTING SLIP MAPICS/HQEP. k. Tab to the REFUND DT (date) ﬁeld and enter the current date (no slashes). l. Click SAVE and a box will pop up in the center of the screen that will (
) TRANSACTION COMPLETED. m. Print screen. n. Repeat steps (e) - (m) as necessary.
After completing the TRAC entries, input information on a user fee refund spreadsheet using the TRAC prints. For each refund, enter:
• Address • Received date (date of original deposit) • Amount paid • Amount refunded • X in the column titled MAPICS (

) Email the completed spreadsheet with a memo to Beckley Finance Center, including the total amount of all refunds to be issued to *CFO BFC Debt lection Helpdesk. Copy the Adjustments Unit manager on the email. (
) TEDS and EDS list user fee amounts and contain these user fee indicators: • Complete (C) • Insufficient (I) • Overpayment (O) • Unknown (U) (
) TEDS and EDS also contain a dishonored user fee indicator of yes (Y) or (N). (
) A case can’t be closed in an approval status with a dishonored user fee indicator of Y or a user fee indicator of I, O, or U. (

) To correct an indicator, an EO Determinations specialist ensures the ate user fee is paid then emails *TE/GE-EO-Adjustments requesting an to the user fee indicator or dishonored check indicator. The request should include the: • Organization’s name • EIN • EDS case number • Appropriate user fee amount Note: If the required information is missing, respond back to the requestor and for the missing information.
Note: If the required information is missing, respond back to the requestor and ask for the missing information.

payment indicator in TEDS: a. Log into TEDS. b. Left click on the word Advanced. A search screen will populate for input your information. c. page (

) This is a TEDS indicator to alert the specialist that there is more than one ﬁle in TEDS under an EIN and the specialist should conﬁrm there are not in multiple open or closed (a prior approval) cases. If the box is marked it will prevent the agent from closing the case ﬁle in TEDS. (

) To correct the error so the case can be closed: a. Log into TEDS. b. Left click on the word Advanced. A search screen will populate for you input your information. c. Enter the EIN in the third blank with the dash (-) in the Properties and hit search. d. Right click on the blue dot and a drop down menu will appear. e. Left click on the blue dot and click on General Case Info. f. Scroll down and locate Potential Duplicate Flag. The box located next will have a check mark. Click on the box and remove the check mark. Ok. g. Email the specialist that the request has been completed and move email to the completed folder. (
) LINUS entity information consists of the applicant name, EIN, and address. Requests to update information are sent by EP/EO specialists, tax secretaries, and clerical support. (
) To make an update: a. Log into LINUS editor. b. Enter your

digit TE number and press return. c. Click on Edit EIN or Entity box and the EIN Edit screen will populate. d. Input the EIN without the dash in the EIN box and press enter. The information will populate. Review the data and determine it is the case ﬁle. e. If correcting the EIN in the Enter Valid EIN lines in the box, input the correct EIN and enter EIN to conﬁrm the EIN. Hit enter. A dialog box populate for you to conﬁrm that you want to update the EIN. Click Ok update the EIN. Note: To conﬁrm any updates made to the LINUS account, long into LINUS Research and enter the EIN without the dash and review all updates. If account updated, you can close LINUS. If the data you entered did not update, repeat the steps above. Make sure the information in LINUS matches TEDS/EDS.
Log into TEDS. Left click on the word Advanced. A search screen will populate for you input your information. Enter the EIN in the third blank with the dash (

) in the Properties and hit search. Right click on the blue dot and a drop down menu will appear. Left click on the blue dot and click on General Case Info. Scroll down and locate Potential Duplicate Flag. The box located next will have a check mark. Click on the box and remove the check mark. Ok. Email the specialist that the request has been completed and move email to the completed folder.
a. Log into LINUS editor. b. Enter your

digit TE number and press return. c. Click on Edit EIN or Entity box and the EIN Edit screen will populate. d. Input the EIN without the dash in the EIN box and press enter. The information will populate. Review the data and determine it is the correct case ﬁle. e. If correcting the EIN in the Enter Valid EIN lines in the box, input the correct EIN and enter EIN to conﬁrm the EIN. Hit enter. A dialog box will populate for you to conﬁrm that you want to update the EIN. Click Ok to update the EIN.

To conﬁrm any updates made to the LINUS account, long into LINUS Research and enter the EIN without the dash and review all updates. If the account updated, you can close LINUS. If the data you entered did not update, repeat the steps above. Make sure the information in LINUS matches TEDS/EDS.
